titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United States Political Ephemera Collection, 1856-2000s RL.11320
titlestmt.author: Paul Sommerfeld, Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-09-18 11:54:56 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The United States Political Ephemera Collection contains campaign materials on both the national and state levels between the years 1856-2008. Materials are mostly related to the Democratic and Republican parties, but include materials from the American Labor party, Greenback party, League of Women Voters, Libertarian party, National Prohibitionist party, and Socialist party, as well as non-partisan materials. Materials include campaign pamphlets, flyers, form letters, newsletters, press releases, booklets, handouts, newspapers, posters, bumper stickers, and buttons.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The United States Political Ephemera Collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gifts and transfers between 1950s-2000s.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], United States Political Ephemera Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Katrina Martin and Paul Sommerfeld, October 2016. This collection includes items formerly held in the Kenneth Hubbard Political Campaign Collection and the Richard Bentley Presidential Campaign Ephemera Collection. These materials were re-sorted and reprocessed into two collections: Kenneth Hubbard Collection of Presidential Campaign Ephemera and the U.S. Political Ephemera Collection in October 2016.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Kenneth Hubbard Collection of Presidential Campaign Ephemera contains materials from various United States presidential elections.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The United States Political Ephemera Collection contains materials from assorted national and state-level campaigns and elections, except U.S. presidential campaigns. (Presidential campaign and election materials are held in the Kenneth Hubbard Collection of Presidential Campaign Ephemera.) This collection is divided into two series: National Politics and State Politics. National Politics contains materials related primarily to the Democratic and Republican parties and their campaigns for congressional and senate elections. It also includes materials from the American Labor party, Greenback party, League of Women Voters, Libertarian party, National Prohibitionist party, and Socialist party, as well as non-partisan materials. Also included are anti-war protest materials from the Vietnam Moratorium Committee. Materials include campaign pamphlets, flyers, form letters, booklets, handouts, newspapers, bumper stickers, and buttons. Filed alphabetically by political party.

State Politics includes campaign material from different states, each placed in their own subseries. The majority of the material comes from North Carolina statee and local elections, with many of the materials from Durham. Materials are mostly related to the Democratic and Republican parties, but also include the American Labor party, Socialist party, and non-partisan materials. Materials include campaign pamphlets, flyers, form letters, newsletters, press releases, booklets, handouts, newspapers, posters, bumper stickers, and buttons. Arranged alphabetically by state; within subseries arranged alphabetically by political party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: National Politics contains materials related primarily to the National Democratic and Republican parties, but also includes materials from the American Labor party, Greenback party, League of Women Voters, Libertarian party, National Prohibitionist party, and Socialist party, as well as non-partisan materials. Also included are anti-war protest materials from the Vietnam Moratorium Committee. Materials include campaign pamphlets, flyers, form letters, booklets, issue papers, handouts, newspapers, bumper stickers, souvenir plastic bags, buttons, and a paper hat. Arranged alphabetically by political party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: State Politics includes campaign material from sixteen different states, each placed in their own subseries. Materials include campaigns for U.S. House of Representatives and Senate, state legislature, governor, mayor, city commissioner, judge, and civic bond issues. The majority of the material comes from North Carolina state-wide and local elections; North Carolina local election materials are primarily from Durham. Materials are mostly related to the Democratic and Republican parties, but also include the American Labor party, Citizens Party, Socialist party, and non-partisan materials.

Materials include campaign pamphlets, flyers, form letters, newsletters, press releases, booklets, handouts, newspapers, posters, postcards, bumper stickers, stickers, and buttons. Arranged alphabetically by state. Within subseries arranged alphabetically by political party.
